concept.title: Analytics data collection
concept.shortdesc: collects data about how you use it. You can opt out of providing this data.

section.title: What data does collect?

ul.li:
The
command executed (for example, bolt task run or bolt plan show), excluding arguments

li.p: The functions called from a plan, excluding arguments

ul.li: Transports used (SSH, WinRM, PCP) and number of targets

li.p:
The number of nodes and groups defined in the
inventory file

The number of nodes targeted with a
command

The number of times
tasks and plans are run (This does not include user-defined tasks or plans.)
The number of statements in an apply block, and how many resources that produces for each target

section.p: This data is associated with a random, non-identifiable user UUID.

To see the data
collects, add --debug to a command.

section.title:
Why does
collect data?
section.p: collects data to help us understand how it's being used and make decisions about how to improve it.

section.title:
How can I opt out of
data collection?
section.p:
To disable the collection of analytics data add the following line to ~/.puppetlabs/bolt/analytics.yaml:
disabled: true
